Discussion on the Mary Travers thread got me thinking about harmonica performances (I was reminded of one with John Sebastian). Anyway, I love a good harmonica, and there are so many, so I thought I'd start a thread for sharing harmonica players people have enjoyed. 
 
 YouTube - "This Train Is Bound For Glory" By Terry Mcmillian (FULL)
 
 Harmonica is a big part of a diverse range of American music. If people have clips of harmonica players from other countries, too, that would be cool.
 
 And, can't talk about harmonica, or American harmonica, without listening to Sonny Boy Williamson II. 
 
 YouTube - BYE BYE BIRD, Sonny Boy Williamson II

I pulled my harpoon out of my dirty red bandanna,
 I was playing soft while Bobby sang the blues.
 Windshield wipers slapping time, I was holding Bobby's hand in mine,
 We sang every song that driver knew.
 
 Freedom's just another word for nothing left to lose,
 Nothing don't mean nothing honey if it ain't free, now now.
 And feeling good was easy, Lord, when he sang the blues,
 You know feeling good was good enough for me,
 Good enough for me and my Bobby McGee....

 One of my favourites beginnings of a book:
 
 " Everything in the world began with a yes. One molecule said yes to another molecule and life was born..." 
 
 It is the opening of "The Hour of the Star" by Clarice Lispector that I just finished reading.
 
 Now, I began to read "Soulstorm" a collection of stories by her.

Larry Adler is the be-all and end-all for me. One cover from the seventies UK pop charts (when he was in his sixties!)
 
 YouTube - Groovin With Mr. Bloe - Hot Hits featuring Larry Adler
 
 And one classic: It Ain't Necessarily So.
